description: Heavy Logistics Vehicle Wheeled (HLVW) \\u2010 Spares \\u2010 Bearing
full_summary:
**Heavy Logistics Vehicle Wheeled (HLVW) – Spares – Bearing Tender Announcement**
=========================================

**Tender Reference:** cb-53-93377289, Amendment Number 2, Solicitation Number W8486-249634/A

**Publication and Closing Dates:**
* Official publication date: 2024-03-01
* Tender closing date and time: 2024-04-08T14:00:00

**Status:**
This tender announcement has been cancelled, in accordance with the amendment number 2.

**Bid Description:**
The Department of National Defence is seeking proposals for the delivery of heavy logistics vehicle wheeled (HLVW) spares, specifically bearings, to the Canadian Forces Supply Depot (CFSD) in Montreal, within thirty (30) calendar days of the contract award.

**Specifications:**
* NSN: 01-678-2360
* BEARING, SPHERICAL, PLAIN
* Part No.: GE110SW, NCAGE: 0AJV0
* Quantity: 20 units
* Unit of issue: Each

**Bidding Requirements:**
Bid submissions must be made via electronic submission only, to DLP53BidsReceiving.DAAT53Receptiondessoumissions@forces.gc.ca. The Crown reserves the right to request samples from bidders for authenticity and equivalency verification.

**Evaluation Criteria:**
The lowest price proposal will be the selection criterion for this tender.

**Additional Information:**
Debriefings can be requested from the contracting authority within fifteen (15) working days of the bid solicitation process results. Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.

**Attachments:**
The solicitation document can be accessed through the following links:

* English solicitation document: <https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/33264/w8486-249634---hlvw---spares---bearing---rfp_eng.pdf>
* French solicitation document: <https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/33264/w8486-249634---vllr---pieces-de-rechange---coussinet---dp_fra_0.pdf> Issue with English "notices" line indicating the document end with RF being hacked.

Let me know if you can re-format to one of the languages of the Canadian government to rid of the URLs like Internet links; only reference as the below, example
